summary: Ann Lyon Strickland was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). Payroll records and certifications from late 1976 through 1978 document her employment, including her salary and pay period earnings. One document specifically pertains to her payroll records, including authorization forms and leave records. Her name also appears on payroll certifications alongside other HSCA staff members. A JFK Assassination System Identification Form also mentions her in the context of background checks conducted on HSCA staff and applicants.
key_connections: U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA)
significance: Ann Lyon Strickland's significance lies in her role as a staff member of the HSCA, contributing to the investigation of the JFK assassination. The documents reflect her employment status and administrative processing within the committee.
